c74object.name: gesture_maker
c74object.digest: Complex gestural control over parametersDetermine the thread which a message is in
c74object.description: gesture_maker is an object for creating multipart gestural control in MaxMSP. Typically, gesture_maker is used to drive a line~ object for audio rate control, and the output is internally scaled to give useful output for musical control. Each gesture has two layers - the main layer, and the inflection layer. Each layer is scaled according to a certain range and scaling type, and the two layers are then combined through multiplication (which is appropriate for most musical cases). The basis of the gesture is the kernel which is made up of up to three curves, which may take a variety of shapes, using power and s-shaped curves. The main layer has only one kernel shape per gesture - the inflection layer has one or more kernel shapes (as specified), which occur one after the other. The shape of each gestural kernel over time can be given with varying degrees of specificity to allow either micro variation of a gesture, or radically different shapes from a single set of values. The timings of the inflection gestures can also be specified as desired. The object can either be triggered to output values at regular intervals (drive mode) over a specified time period, or to produce output at given points in time (events mode). Additionally, gesture_maker objects may be chained together to control multiple parameters in parallel.

method.name: drive
method.digest: Realise the gesture with drive mode
method.description:
Realise the gesture with the specified duration in drive mode by inputting the drive message to the left inlet.
The message should be formatted as:
drive / duration in milliseconds

method.name: events
method.digest: Realise the gesture with events mode
method.description:
Realise the gesture with the given timings in events mode. The gesture is evaluted at specific points in time as specified by a list of timing values.
The gesture is evaluated at time zero and then after each of the specified delays.
The message should be formatted as:
events / list of time points in milliseconds

method.name: list
method.description:
gesture_maker can be externally driven by connecting the right outlet of one gesture_maker into the right inlet of another gesture_maker.
The format for the external_drive in/out is a list containing the normalised time (0-1) and the grain duration.

method.name: gesture_inflections
method.description:
Set the *next* inflection gesture kernel parameters. Each kernel is added to the internal inflection kernel list.
See gesture_main for a list of all the shapes.

method.name: gesture_main
method.digest: Set the main gesture kernel parameters
method.description:
Each kernel can have one of several shape types that allow only the minimum number of values to be specified.
The shape types are:
flat
kernel takes a single value for its duration.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / flat / flat val
line
kernel is a single line or curved from one value to another.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / line / start val / end val / curve vals
line_flat
A single line or curve until the given time value followed by a single value for the rest of the kernel .
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / line_flat / time / start val / end val / curve vals
flat_line
A single value up until the specified time and then a single line or curve.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / flat_line / time / start val / end val / curve vals
triangle_return
Two lines (or curves) - the second returns to the same value with which the kernel starts.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / triangle_return / time / start val / target val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2
triangle
Two lines (or curves).
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / triangle / time / start val / target val / end val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2
plateau_return
Three lines (or curves) - the central one is flat (single value) and the kernel ends on the same value it begins.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / plateau_return / time 1 / time 2 / start val / target val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2
plateau
Three lines (or curves) - the central one is flat (single value).
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / plateau / time 1 / time 2 / start val / target val / end val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2
return
Three lines (or curves) - the kernel begins and ends on the same value.
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / return / time 1 / time 2 / start val / first target val / second target val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2 / curve vals 3
general
a kernel with three unconstrained lines (or curves).
The message should be formatted as:
gesture_main / general / time 1 / time 2 / start val / first target val / second target val / end val / curve vals 1 / curve vals 2 / curve vals 3
All shapes are possible using the general shape, but it is usually simpler to use one of the more restricted forms.

method.name: graintime
method.description:
Set the duration in milliseconds between outputs when using drive mode.
The message should be formatted as:
graintime / time (defualt 20ms)
Longer graintime gives less temporal resolution, but reduce calculations per unit time.

method.name: initial_inflections
method.digest: Set initial value for inflections layer
method.description:
Set the initial normalised float value (0-1) for the inflections layer (only needed when the first inflection starts with a value specified by the "last" specifier).
The message should be formatted as:
initial_inflections / normalised float (0-1)

method.name: initial_main
method.digest: Set initial value for main layer
method.description:
Set the initial normalised float value (0-1) for the main layer (only needed when the main kernel starts with a value specified by the "last" specifier).
The message should be formatted as:
initial_main / normalised float (0-1)

method.name: reset
method.description: Sending the reset message to the left inlet clears all stored gesture information.

method.name: scaling_inflections
method.digest: Set scaling for the inflection layer
method.description:
Set the scaling for the inflection layer using one of several useful musical scalings.
The message should be formatted as:
scaling_main / mode / min output / max output
The different modes are :
none - kernal left in 0-1 range
scale - linear scaling
log - scale from logarithmic 0-1 input to linear output (exponential scaling)
exp - scale from exponetial 0-1 input to linear output (logarithmic scaling)
pitch - scale from linear 0-1 input to range specified in semitones (linear scaling) then convert to a speed / freq multiplier
amp - scale from linear (0-1) input to specified range in decibels (linear scaling) then output as linear amplitude

method.name: scaling_main
method.digest: Set scaling for the main layer
method.description:
Set the scaling for the main layer using one of several useful musical scalings.
The message should be formatted as:
scaling_main / mode / min output / max output
The different modes are :
none - kernal left in 0-1 range
scale - linear scaling
log - scale from logarithmic 0-1 input to linear output (exponential scaling)
exp - scale from exponetial 0-1 input to linear output (logarithmic scaling)
pitch - scale from linear 0-1 input to range specified in semitones (linear scaling) then convert to a speed / freq multiplier
amp - scale from linear (0-1) input to specified range in decibels (linear scaling) then output as linear amplitude

method.name: stop
method.description: Stop the gesture part way through (note that the last output of each kernel is always retained).

method.name: timings
method.description:
Set the timings for inflection gestures. The values should be specified in normalised time (0-1).
The message should be formatted as:
timings / list of timings

entry.name: output
entry.description:
The first outlet outputs a bang when the gesture is complete.
The second outlet outputs the values over time to be fed into a line~.
The third outlet is the drive out output and is used to sync multiple gesture_maker objects together. The output is a list containing the normalised time (0-1) and the grain duration.
